item.title: Using Caddy with Rails
item.description: This is a bit of a brief one. If you search Google for ways to serve a Rails app running on Puma via Caddy server, you get nothing. Truly, nothing. Zilch, nada, despite my quite well practiced Google-fu. Apparently it’s just not done, or something. However, despite the fact that most possible Caddyfile configurations result in 502: Bad Gateway, there is one which works: https://domainname.co.uk { root /path/to/app/root log /path/to/app/root/log/access.log tls webmaster@domainname.
